conclusion: The power of the electromagnetic railgun can be calculated using the formula P = Fv, where F is the force acting on the projectile and v is the velocity of the projectile.
The force acting on the projectile is the Lorentz force, which can be calculated using the formula F = BIL, where B is the magnetic field strength, I is the rail current, and L is the rail length.
Substituting the given values into the formula, we get F = 1 T * 10 A * 0.5 m = 5 N.
The projectile is launched at high speed along the rails, but the specific velocity is not given.

premise: Assume velocity is constant during launch, use v = d/t
conclusion: We can express the velocity as v = 0.02 m / t.
Substituting the calculated values of F and v into the formula P = Fv, we get P = 5 N * (0.02 m / t) = 0.1 Nm/t.
